Class XmlAdapterBytecodeGenerator

extends Object

A generator of bytecode for UniversalXmlAdapter subclasses.

Laird Nelson

EMPTY_BYTE_ARRAY

private static final byte[] EMPTY_BYTE_ARRAY
An empty byte array suitable for edge cases encountered by the generate(String, String, String) method. This field is never null.

getAdapterClassName

public final String getAdapterClassName(String packageName,
                                        String interfaceName,
                                        String className)
Returns the name for a UniversalXmlAdapter subclass, as formatted appropriately for a package named by the supplied packageName parameter, a Class to be adapted named by the supplied interfaceName parameter and an implementation Class named by the supplied className parameter.

This method never returns null.

Parameters:
packageName - the name of a package; must not be null
interfaceName - a valid Java class name; must not be null
className - a valid Java class name; must not be null
Returns:
a non-null Java class name
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if any of the parameters is null
IllegalStateException - if getAdapterClassNameTemplate() returns null
See Also:
getAdapterClassNameTemplate(), setAdapterClassNameTemplate(String)

getSimpleName

private static final String getSimpleName(String name)
Returns the last segment of a period-separated name, or the supplied name itself if it is null or not period-separated.

This method may return null.

Parameters:
name - the name to parse; may be null
Returns:
the last segment of the supplied name if it is period-separated, or the supplied name itself if it is either null or not period-separated

generate

public final <I,C extends I> byte[] generate(String adapterClassName,
                                             Class<I> interfaceClass,
                                             Class<C> implementationClass)
                      throws BadBytecode,
                             CannotCompileException,
                             IOException,
                             NotFoundException
Calls the generate(String, String, String) method, supplying it with the supplied adapterClassName, the name of the supplied interfaceClass and the name of the supplied implementationClass, and returns its results.

This method does not validate that the supplied interfaceClass parameter} is an interface, only that the supplied implementationClass implements or extends it.

This method never returns null.

Type Parameters:
I - a type to be adapted
C - an implementation type that implements the <I> type
Parameters:
adapterClassName - the name of the UniversalXmlAdapter subclass; must not be null
interfaceClass - the interface being adapted; must not be null
implementationClass - the Class that is (a) not an interface and (b) guaranteed to be an implementation of the supplied interfaceClass; must not be null
Returns:
a non-null array of bytes representing the UniversalXmlAdapter subclass suitable for feeding to ClassLoader.defineClass(String, byte[], int, int) or for serialization to storage as a valid class file
Throws:
BadBytecode - if Javassist had problems with bytecode generation
CannotCompileException - if Javassist had problems with bytecode generation
IOException - if there was a problem reading or writing
NotFoundException - if Javassist had problems with bytecode generation
See Also:
generate(String, String, String), getAdapterClassName(String, String, String)

generate

public byte[] generate(String adapterClassName,
                       String interfaceClassName,
                       String implementationClassName)
                throws BadBytecode,
                       CannotCompileException,
                       IOException,
                       NotFoundException
Generates and returns the bytecode for a UniversalXmlAdapter subclass with the supplied adapterClassName as its name that relies upon the fact that Objects that implement an interface with the supplied interfaceClassName will be instances of a Class with the supplied implementationClassName.

This method does not validate that the supplied interfaceClassName parameter actually identifies a loadable Class that is an interface nor that the supplied implementationClassName actually identifies a loadable Class that is not an interface and an implementation of the interface named by the supplied interfaceClassName. Consequently the resulting bytecode may not be functional in certain cases.

This method never returns null.

Parameters:
adapterClassName - the name of the UniversalXmlAdapter subclass; must not be null
interfaceClassName - the name of the interface being adapted; must not be null
implementationClassName - the name of a Class that is (a) not an interface and (b) guaranteed to be an implementation of the interface designated by the interfaceClassName parameter; must not be null
Returns:
a non-null array of bytes representing the UniversalXmlAdapter subclass suitable for feeding to ClassLoader.defineClass(String, byte[], int, int) or for serialization to storage as a valid class file
Throws:
BadBytecode - if Javassist had problems with bytecode generation
CannotCompileException - if Javassist had problems with bytecode generation
IOException - if there was a problem reading or writing
NotFoundException - if Javassist had problems with bytecode generation
See Also:
getAdapterClassName(String, String, String)

getClassPool

protected ClassPool getClassPool(String className)
Returns a Javassist ClassPool that is appropriate for the supplied class name.

The default implementation of this method ignores the className parameter and returns the return value of ClassPool.getDefault(). For nearly all cases, this is the correct behavior and this method should not be overridden.

If overrides of this method opt to return null, the return value of ClassPool.getDefault() will be used internally instead.

This method is protected, not private, only because the actual semantics of the ClassPool.getDefault() are underspecified. This allows consumers of this class to override this behavior if they are expecting ClassPools to be produced in different ways.

Parameters:
className - the class name for which the returned ClassPool might be appropriate; may be null and may safely be ignored; provided for contextual information only
Returns:
a ClassPool instance, or null, since the ClassPool.getDefault() does not document whether it is prohibited from returning null
See Also:
ClassPool, ClassPool.getDefault()
